result.title: "Report on organization of international summer-school - ""Immuno-Oncology"""
result.description: Report on organized summer-school will include an agenda, a list of participants, presentations and conclusions. Each of the reports will be complemented by an evaluation on whether the concerned activities contribute to the Research Potential increase of the applicants and the necessary measures to be taken in order to preserve the sustainability of the implemented actions or benefits. Report will also include the summary of STREAM financial resources exploitation.

result.title: Socio-economic Impact of SLA-Ready and Exploitation Plan
result.description: Analyses the impact of SLA-Ready on the European economy, characterising it on the demand and supply sides. It provides a minimum set of case studies and draws on relevant analyst reports and expert interviews. It assesses the sustainability of SLA-Ready Support-as-a-Service based on technical, financial, marketing and human support KPIs, related costs and presents the final exploitation plan.

project.title: SLA-Ready: Making Cloud SLAs readily usable in the EU private sector

result.title: Methodological Framework of Ex-Post Analysis
result.description: The deliverable is a framework of principal hypotheses – matching principles- by which best matches may be achieved and thus optimum performance of the funding and financing schemes for the particular business model under the implementation and transport mode context in the defined governance arrangement. Its concerns a report of the matching principles identified using the risk profiles of the types and typologies produced in WP2. These are proposed based on their contribution to designed performance in terms of sustainability (economic, environmental, social and institutional). This is the deliverable of Task 3.1.

project.title: BUSINESS MODELS FOR ENHANCING FUNDING AND ENABLING FINANCING OF INFRASTRUCTURE IN TRANSPORT

result.title: WeHubs Operational Framework
result.description: A detailed description of the WeHubs model and services, how this can be established and integrated in the general offering of all kinds of incubators and accelerators. The first versions of this operational framework will be produced at M8 with an updated model included as part of the sustainability plan in M20.
